verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Direct introduction, as in Hebrew text.

verses.text: Speak to Aaron, to his sons, and to all the people of Israel, and say to them: This is the command that the LORD has given.
If anyone of the house of Israel kills an ox, a lamb, or a goat in the camp, or kills it outside the camp,
verses.comment: 'Kills' reflects 'slaughters'; species named as in Hebrew.

verses.text: and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting to offer it as an offering to the LORD before the LORD’s tabernacle, that man will be guilty of bloodshed; he has shed blood, and that man will be cut off from among his people.
verses.comment: 'Guilty of bloodshed' follows Hebrew idiom for manslaughter.

verses.text: This is so the people of Israel may bring their sacrifices that they offer in the open field to the LORD, to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and offer them as peace offerings to the LORD.
The priest will sprinkle the blood on the altar of the LORD at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and burn the fat for a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
They must no longer sacrifice their offerings to the goat-demons, after whom they prostitute themselves. This will be a permanent statute for them throughout their generations.
verses.comment: 'Goat-demons' (Heb. 'se'irim') refers to spirits associated with goats.

verses.text: You are to say to them: Any one of the house of Israel, or of the foreigners who sojourn among them, who offers a burnt offering or sacrifice
verses.comment: Distinction between Israelite or resident foreigner.

verses.text: and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting to offer it to the LORD, that man will be cut off from his people.
verses.comment: 'Cut off' as in the Hebrew, may indicate banishment.

verses.text: If anyone from the house of Israel or from the foreigners who sojourn among them eats any blood, I will set my face against that person and will cut him off from among his people.
verses.comment: 'Set my face against' as literal Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have given it to you on the altar to make atonement for your souls. For it is the blood that makes atonement by the life.
verses.comment: 'Life' is the same Hebrew word as 'soul' (nephesh).

verses.text: Therefore I have said to the people of Israel: No person among you shall eat blood, nor shall any foreigner who sojourns among you eat blood.
verses.comment: Repeated for emphasis, as in original.

verses.text: Any one of the people of Israel, or of the foreigners who sojourn among them, who hunts and catches any animal or bird that may be eaten, shall pour out its blood and cover it with dust.
verses.comment: Instruction covers game animals not sacrificial animals.

verses.text: For as to the life of all flesh, its blood is related to its life. I have said to the people of Israel: You shall not eat the blood of any creature, for the life of every creature is its blood. Whoever eats it will be cut off.
verses.comment: Faithful to Hebrew repetition for emphasis.

verses.text: And any person, native or foreigner, who eats something found dead or torn by beasts must wash his clothes and bathe in water and be unclean until evening. Then he will be clean.
But if he does not wash them or bathe his body, he shall bear his iniquity.
verses.comment: 'Bear his iniquity' is a literal rendering of the Hebrew idiom.
